page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY OLD CROSSES
page.content: In the church yard just outside the church door stands the upright of a granite cross.Each of the four sides is decorated with Celtic patterns.This cross shaft is reputed to be one of the finest in Cornwall and it probably dates from about the 10th century.Mr Axford,a well known local historian, believes this cross was associated with a college of priests at St Neot in the time of the Norman Conquest.There are also four other ancient crosses nearby.There is a Latin cross which originally came from St Kew and three fifteenth century Latin crosses in the garden of the vicarage.One of these crosses came from the Crow Pound (see page 19) on Goonzion Downs.There are also ancient crosses at Hilltown, Polmenna,Newtown,Tredinnick Chapel and at Wenmouth Cross.
